ProfessionalSummary:
Skilled and flexible Telecoms Engineer with over 30 years experience having exposure in a diverse variety of dynamic roles (Implementation /Operations & Support) including I&C, OAM, NMC, design (network, sync, SOC) & Field Project Management. Comprehensive knowledge of fixed network technologies: SDH/SONET/PDH/DWDM;

Experienced Operation and Maintenance Support of Level(3) Goswell ,Braham ,Leman St and Level(3) Pops  for 5 years .Extensive knowledge of the electrical and mechanical infrastructure and under standing of the  Level(3) ethos

EducationDetails.Text:
Jan '95 - May '95	College of North London
Data Communications Module Level 3.

Sept '93   June '94	University of Westminster, Harrow, Middlesex
Completed the 2 year HNC in Electronic Engineering.
June '87   Oct '88	No.1 Radio School, Weston Super Mare, Avon

Sept '82   June '85	Blyth Tynedale High School, Blyth, Northumberland
'O' Levels	CSE's Mathematics	English Language
Physics	English Literature
Biology	History
Applied Science
Geography
BTEC(M) Electronics (ONC equivalent) and City & Guilds	Electronic Workshop Practices.

ExperienceSummary.Description: ~~~~~~~~   is experienced in:  Information Technology (Network); and Engineering.    ~~~~~~~~   has 22 years of work experience, with 11 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Current position is a low-level management role: ISP Project Manager/Engineer
Starting on 8/1/2018, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 2 years and 7 months:
	Title: ISP Project Manager/Engineer
Starting on 12/1/2012, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 2 years and 6 months:
	Title: Technical Project Manager Google EMEA
Starting on 3/1/2000, the candidate held the following low-level management position for 5 years and 10 months:
	Title: Goswell Rd City Engineer/Data Centre Manager for Level(3) Communications

Positions.Description:
Manage Space and Power builds for Zayo throughout Europe.
Create Budgets and POs
Negotiate with Data Centre for pricing on racks, ducting ,power, Installations
Writing processes and MOPS for vendors
Managing third party contractors to undertake installations
Sign off of installations
Using Salesforce to manage budgets/projects
Using inventory tool M^ to manage the Zayo onsite rack and power inventory

Installation and commissioning of Optical/IP Networks.Ciena 6500s, Adva, Accedian,Juniper.
RFC/Bert testing of Optical ccts.
Supervision of contractors both in the UK and Europe
Liaison with all parts of the business to co-ordinate installations
On call to cover fault escalations contractors are unable to deal with.
Install of DC Rectifiers and Dc Cabling
Travel throughout Europe installing all of the equipment above
Using Data Access procedures for deliveries etc
Writing technical MOPS a for installations and installation guides

Responsible design both optical and physical including power,rack and over-head infrastructure for Pop builds
Project lead for all the new and existing Pop builds in the EMEA
Led a team 3 project managers to design all of Google Pop builds in the EMEA from design to build
Reported to the lead Project Manager for Operations in the EMEA .Presented reports on status and dates
Created standards and templates to streamline build processes. Create SOWs and design documents for network infrastructure and optical cabling for both ISP and OSP
Responsible for the ordering of all Materials for Pop Builds
Liaise across several organizations across Google
Extensive travel throughout the EMEA to accept new Pop Builds
Worked under pressure and important to get the details correct first time
Managed vendors in all EMEA countries. Responsible to get them to build what we wanted not what they thought we wanted .Overcome culture barriers Identified risks and escalated as required

Responsible for Abovenet's UK Transmission Metro Network both IP layer 2 and Transmission equipment
Installation and commissioning of Ciena 4200 micro and classis chassis
Installation and commissioning of Nortel 5100 ,5200 and 6500 equipment
Installation and commission of Avda FSP150 metro equipment
Installation and commission of Juniper EX4200's
Installation and commission of Accedian
Configuration of the layer 2 Cisco/Juniper network
1st/2nd line support on the UK metro network.
Maintaining all documentation and engineering standards
Interfacing with clients and customers during both installation and faults
Working under pressure
Project managing Data Centre private suite fit out and Undertaking surveys of both power and cooling of data centre to improve efficiency and cut costs.
Undertake and Project the Power Upgrade in Abovenet C8.Involved installed all DCX plant and UPS systems


Training Courses
Nortel 5200 and 6500
Ciena4200

overseeing the installation and operation integration of both Optical and Copper infrastructure in BT Exchanges for the BT21CN roll out
Liaising with customer representatives to make sure the telecoms project run to time and budget.
Produce daily and weekly reports
Leadership and motivation of small teams of telecommunications engineers.
Resolving any day to day issues

Training Courses
Huawei Msan Installation and Maintenance
Huawei Optical DWDM Installation, Commissioning  and Maintenance

JobTitle.Raw: Goswell Rd City Engineer/Data Centre Manager
JobTitle.Normalized: Goswell Rd City Engineer/Data Centre Manager

Positions.JobLevel: Senior Manager (more than 5 years management experience)
Positions.Description:
Providing management, supervision ,guidance ,leadership to Technicians and allocation of work day to day in orderb to meet the needs of the business and customers.
Providing 1st /2nd line tech support for Technicians ,Customer care and RMC (NoC)
Responsibility for over seeing all installations in the gateway (Data Centre) and all on-site of Level(3) /Vendor provided equipment
Maintaining the standard of engineering practices amongst the technicians
Contact for all building issues power ,security and air conditioning
Dealing with customer problems within the Level(3)gateway and customer Pops
Managing the Quality Assurance of any third party installations with the Level(3) facility
Producing reports of work installed etc to the Operations manager and Director
Use of various Level(3) Fault ,provisioning ,management and alarm databases.
Monitoring JCI BMS and understanding  the alarms and the actions required to resolve issue
1st Line fault finding on both Electrical and Mechanical infrastructure.
Management of complicated electrical switching at Goswell Rd when required
Approving method  statements and risk assessments and assessing their impact on the building

Courses attended:
Nortel Optera LH/DX/DWDM equipment
Alacatel 5200 Packet Engine
Nortel CS3K VoIP equipment
Alacatel ADM commissioning    ~~~~~~~~~  
W&G OTDR Course/Power Meters
Currently Studying for CCNA certificate
Pillar & Eaton UPS Training
Eltek DC O&M Training
NEBOSH Certified

Installation ,maintenance and fault  diagnostics of  SDH ccts STM 1 through to STM64 (DWDM) nationally and international
Installation of DIA (Direct Internet Access) and managed routers for customers. Involved the use of CSUs and Cisco 1601s .Plus basic IP configuration and trouble shooting
Using WWG Ant20 SDH  testers ,PFA testers to test PDH E1 & X21 ccts .Also using Fibre test equipment to check for appropriate power levels
Maintenance of all the DSX ,OSX and Equipment in the gateway
Installation and Commissioning Alcatel ADMs 1641,1651and 1664

Trainings.Text:
Ciena K2
Ericsson  AXD 4/4-2 and 4/1-2 FLM/SLM and Commissioning course
Alcatel 1630 Daccs
Alcatel Operation & Maintenance    ~~~~~~~~~   Course
Alacatel 1686 Long Distance and DWDM equipment
Cisco ICRC
ANT20 & Domino Course

July '96 - April '99
IXnet, City of London - Employed as DMS100 Switch Engineer responsible for

Daily operational and maintenance of the DMS100 which involves datafill and installation of switched services.
Testing and fault diagnostics of switch services involving the use of protocol analyser, DACCS and other test equipment.
Understanding of CCS7, DPNSS, DASS, CAS and EURO ISDN PRI protocol.
Testing E1's, fractional E1's, data ccts using W&G and Sunrise test equipment.
Operational and maintenance of WAN (Newbridge Network).
Use of Aculab Groomer.
Liaising with customers and third party engineers for the installation/commissioning of switch/voice services.
Involved in the day to day running of the Nortel 61C PBX

Courses attended:- Introduction to DMS100, Level 1 and Level 2 operation and maintenance.
Universal translations.
PRSM.
Operational Measurements.
Newbridge 3600 O&M and 46020

April '87   July '96
Royal Air Force, various locations in the UK and Overseas.Pindar   Ministry of Defence, Whitehall, London

Posted as a Telecommunications Shift Engineer responsible for:
•	Engineering secure, insecure data and voice systems on a national and international basis.
•	Supervising a Phillips digital telephone exchange which involves fault finding to board level and extensive exchange peripheral testing.
•	Maintaining and repairing cryptographic equipment, multiplexers and modem equipment involving the use of various types of test equipment.
•	Ensuring the continuity of all copper and fibre optic circuits within my area of responsibility and occasionally installing new circuits.
•	Carrying out camera duties on a video conferencing system.
•	Testing military and civilian data trunks using CODEC and AUX test equipment.
•	The co ordination and maintenance of all section Air Publication technical and servicing manuals

Courses attended:-
• Modems
• Phillips Digital Exchange		• First Aid
• International Reporting System	• Fibre Optics
Tactical Communications Wing Detachment, Tabuk, Saudi Arabia
Trainings.Entity: Tactical Communications Wing Detachment, Tabuk, Saudi Arabia

Trainings.Text: Posted as a Mobile Telecommunications Engineer responsible for establishing and maintaining a secure data communications circuit back to the UK via satellite. Engineering an insecure telegraphy circuit used to establish secure data and voice circuits
Tactical Communications Wing, Royal Air Force, Brize Norton, Oxfordshire
Trainings.Entity: Tactical Communications Wing, Royal Air Force

Trainings.Text:
Posted as a Mobile Telecommunications Engineer responsible for:
Mobilizing as part of a Telecommunications Team to any part of the world at short notice to establish secure and insecure telecommunications circuits back to the United Kingdom.
Maintaining HF, UVF and VHF radio equipment and when required, erecting aerials and generators
Employed as an Apprentice Technician responsible for basic circuit assembly, fault finding and the assembly of door entry systems
Sept 85   Sept 86	British Gas, Cramlington, Northumberland

Employed on a Youth Training Scheme at the British Gas Online Inspection Centre where I gained experience in:
•	Basic circuit assembly and fault finding using milling machines, lathes and electrical installation and some basic computer knowledge

Hobbies: In my spare time I enjoy relaxing with a round of golf and currently play off' a handicap of 13 and enjoy a spot of DIY.

Findings.Message: Each section type should only appear once in a resume.
An email address was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include an email address.
A street level address was not found in the contact information. A full contact address should always be included in a resume as it allows for location based searches.
Every position in a resume should have an employer name.
Every degree in a resume should have a name or type associated with it, such as 'B.S.' or 'M.S.'.
High school (or lower) education should not be included on resumes that contain higher-level education.
Your resume includes a References section. References should NEVER be included in a resume.
Driving license information should usually not be included in a resume (for most cultures).
Date of birth information should not be included in a resume (for most cultures).
Every section should have a clear, unambiguous, commonly-used header on a separate line directly above the content associated with it.
